Welcome


An aspiring computer science student with a passion for aesthetics, creation and computers.

Contact information in the footer and Contact tab.


Hi, it's Winnie!


I am currently attending University of Toronto, program for Specialist Computer Science - Software Engineering Stream. My interest in computer science started in grade 10. Now, I have 4 years of experience and knowledge of multiple programming languages under my belt.

Currently, I am a teaching assistant for a first year computer science course, a student ambassador campus tour guide, and a WiCSM mentor.

I have also volunteered for various STEM related roles for students interested in pursuing the field in their future.

Incoming Developer at RBC Royal Bank for Winter 2020.

Projects


Presently:

Pineapple, an eCommerce Android Application

  • Developed an eCommerce android application using Java, SQLite, and Android Studio following Scrum implementation of Agile of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
  • Managed and organized a team of 4 as the scrum master, with the team following a Main/Feature branching strategy and code management through subversion (SVN)

File Cabinet, an Evernote replica

  • Developed an Evernote replica web application using Ruby, Ruby on Rails, HTML/HAML, and CSS/SASS, hosted on Heroku, that creates, stores, edits, and deletes notes, following the MVC

Just Peachy, a webpage designs site

  • Created a webpage designs website using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python, hosted on App Engine with purpose of displaying webpage designs
  • Designed and created all featured webpages with developed senses of creativity, aesthetics, and intentions to showcase possible creative ideas for a webpage

Activities


Presently:

WiCSM Mentor

  • Participated in the first ever mentorship program with WiCSM to assist first year female CMS students feel a sense of community within their program
  • Mentored students one-on-one in many different aspects, such as resume help, study habits, campus tours, and gave general tips for first-year university students

Student Ambassador (Tour Guide)

  • Guided prospective students and parents through campus in groups of 5 or more people for 45-minute tours and clarified inquires to assist in making post-secondary decisions
